member.name: T:Argon.DefaultValueHandling
member.summary: Specifies default value handling options for the .

member.name: F:Argon.DefaultValueHandling.Include
member.summary: Include members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects. Included members are written to JSON. Has no effect when deserializing.

member.name: F:Argon.DefaultValueHandling.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects so that it is not written to JSON. This option will ignore all default values (e.g. null for objects and nullable types; 0 for integers, decimals and floating point numbers; and false for booleans). The default value ignored can be changed by placing the on the property.

member.name: F:Argon.DefaultValueHandling.Populate
member.summary: Members with a default value but no JSON will be set to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: F:Argon.DefaultValueHandling.IgnoreAndPopulate
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects and set members to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: T:Argon.EscapeHandling
member.summary: Specifies how strings are escaped when writing JSON text.

member.name: F:Argon.EscapeHandling.Default
member.summary: Only control characters (e.g. newline) are escaped.

member.name: F:Argon.EscapeHandling.EscapeNonAscii
member.summary: All non-ASCII and control characters (e.g. newline) are escaped.

member.name: F:Argon.EscapeHandling.EscapeHtml
member.summary: HTML (<, >, &, ', ") and control characters (e.g. newline) are escaped.

member.name: F:Argon.EscapeHandling.None
member.summary: Don't escape any characters.

member.name: T:Argon.FloatFormatHandling

member.name: F:Argon.FloatFormatHandling.String
member.summary: Write special floating point values as strings in JSON, e.g. "NaN", "Infinity", "-Infinity".

member.name: F:Argon.FloatFormatHandling.Symbol
member.summary: Write special floating point values as symbols in JSON, e.g. NaN, Infinity, -Infinity. Note that this will produce non-valid JSON.

member.name: F:Argon.FloatFormatHandling.DefaultValue
member.summary: Write special floating point values as the property's default value in JSON, e.g. 0.0 for a property, null for a of property.

member.name: T:Argon.FloatParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how floating point numbers, e.g. 1.0 and 9.9, are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:Argon.FloatParseHandling.Double
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: F:Argon.FloatParseHandling.Decimal
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.TypeNameHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets how type name writing and reading is handled by the serializer. The default value is .
member.remarks: should be used with caution when your application deserializes JSON from an external source. Incoming types should be validated with a custom when deserializing with a value other than .

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.MetadataPropertyHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets how metadata properties are used during deserialization. The default value is .

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.TypeNameAssemblyFormatHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets how a type name assembly is written and resolved by the serializer. The default value is .

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.ConstructorHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets how constructors are used during deserialization. The default value is .

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.ContractResolver
member.summary: Gets or sets the contract resolver used by the serializer when serializing .NET objects to JSON and vice versa.

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.EqualityComparer
member.summary: Gets or sets the equality comparer used by the serializer when comparing references.

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.ReferenceResolverProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets a function that creates the used by the serializer when resolving references.

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.SerializationBinder
member.summary: Gets or sets the used by the serializer when resolving type names.

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.Error
member.summary: Gets or sets the error handler called during serialization and deserialization.

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.MaxDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth allowed when reading JSON. Reading past this depth will throw a . A null value means there is no maximum. The default value is 64.

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.Formatting
member.summary: Indicates how JSON text output is formatted. The default value is .

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.FloatFormatHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets how special floating point numbers, e.g. , and , are written as JSON. The default value is .

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.FloatParseHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets how floating point numbers, e.g. 1.0 and 9.9, are parsed when reading JSON text. The default value is .

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.EscapeHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets how strings are escaped when writing JSON text. The default value is .

member.name: P:Argon.JsonSerializerSettings.CheckAdditionalContent
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether there will be a check for additional content after deserializing an object. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Argon.JsonTextReader.ReadAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously reads the next JSON token from the source.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous read. The property returns true if the next token was read successfully; false if there are no more tokens to read.
member.remarks: Derived classes must override this method to get asynchronous behaviour. Otherwise it will execute synchronously, returning an already-completed task.

member.name: T:Argon.TypeNameAssemblyFormatHandling
member.summary: Indicates the method that will be used during deserialization for locating and loading assemblies.

member.name: F:Argon.TypeNameAssemblyFormatHandling.Simple
member.summary: In simple mode, the assembly used during deserialization need not match exactly the assembly used during serialization. Specifically, the version numbers need not match as the LoadWithPartialName method of the class is used to load the assembly.

member.name: F:Argon.TypeNameAssemblyFormatHandling.Full
member.summary: In full mode, the assembly used during deserialization must match exactly the assembly used during serialization. The Load method of the class is used to load the assembly.

member.name: T:Argon.TypeNameHandling
member.summary: Specifies type name handling options for the .
member.remarks: should be used with caution when your application deserializes JSON from an external source. Incoming types should be validated with a custom when deserializing with a value other than .

member.name: F:Argon.TypeNameHandling.None
member.summary: Do not include the .NET type name when serializing types.

member.name: F:Argon.TypeNameHandling.Objects
member.summary: Include the .NET type name when serializing into a JSON object structure.

member.name: F:Argon.TypeNameHandling.Arrays
member.summary: Include the .NET type name when serializing into a JSON array structure.

member.name: F:Argon.TypeNameHandling.All
member.summary: Always include the .NET type name when serializing.

member.name: F:Argon.TypeNameHandling.Auto
member.summary: Include the .NET type name when the type of the object being serialized is not the same as its declared type. Note that this doesn't include the root serialized object by default. To include the root object's type name in JSON you must specify a root type object with or .
